headline: ‘Gutfeld!’ on Fauci, media coverage of Trump
subHeadline: Guests: Kat Timpf, Julie Banderas, Sean Avery, Clay Travis

utterances.speaker: ALISYN CAMEROTA, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: In October, you were on a Zoom call with your colleagues from The New Yorker magazine. Everyone took a break for several minutes during which time you were caught masturbating on camera. You were subsequently fired from that job after 27 years of working there. And you since then have been on leave from CNN. Do I have all that right?

utterances.speaker: JEFFREY TOOBIN, CNN LEGAL ANALYST
utterances.sentences: You got it all right. Sad to say.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Both hands on the desk, please, Jeffrey. Welcome back. I'm Greg Gutfeld. Or as the police like to call me, recidivists subway flasher. We've got a great panel today. Kat is still here even after what the cops say was a terrible pool float incident.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Your dad laughing like that. Got to hand it to Kat though like that rash I got from that teddy bear I found on the train tracks. She keeps coming back. Former NHL player Sean Avery is here. That's hockey, right? Plus, my fellow sports commentator, Clay Travis is with us. Sean and Clay decided to share a ride to the studio today.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. And there is the return of Julie Banderas which is about as welcome as another leak from the Wuhan lab. Boy, boy, did she have a wild afternoon in the park today?

utterances.speaker: JULIE BANDERAS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Oh, Jesus. I good so look in those shorts though.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You really did. I hope you're taking aspirin and you're hydrating.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: I'm fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: As for me, I'm great I had an awesome workout before I got my haircut this afternoon.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's all natural. So, here's a question. How many media screw ups do you need to hear before you realize it's deliberate? How many times does Wolf Blitzer get to cry wolf? Every week an explosive story we are told was true turns out to be as false as Julie's eyelashes. Today's big lie, the story of how President Donald Trump ordered Lafayette Square cleared with tear gas to vacate peaceful protesters for a callus photo op. The Press covered it with a cicada like fervor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The Secretary of Defense in a photo op in front of a church after these peaceful protesters had been brutalized because of the President's plans.

utterances.speaker: ERIN BURNETT, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: The President wanted this photo op and he wanted to disperse that crowd because he is, you know, he wants an image of this -- all of these protests being one thing which is violent.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Why does Trump everyone else's rights as a U.S. citizen to be in those streets outside the White House? Why did they get tear gassed? You know, and Trump gets a photo op.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: These guys are more full of crap than a septic tank and a bean factory. You know what I'm talking about, Julie?

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: In fact, the inspector general's report on the matter concluded, I have to read this whole thing. We found that the USPP had the authority and discretion to clear the park and the surrounding areas on June 1st. The evidence we obtained did not support a finding that the USPP cleared the park to allow the president to survey the damage and walk to St. John's Church. Instead, the evidence we reviewed showed that the USPP cleared the park to allow the contractor to safely install the antiscale fencing. Now you'd expect those media hacks to walk it all back, but our media can barely walk at all. I wonder if CNN is covering this. UNIDENTIFIED MALE:

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You know, I think like 5000 cicadas taste just like shrimp.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh yes. They didn't serve these at weddings.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It seems like Cinnamon Toast Crunch and Captain Crunch had a baby.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, a delicious baby.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Just another CNN cooking segment for the homeless. Now this is just one lie but it's part of an ongoing delouse. Delouse of lie so endless you can't keep track of them all. It's like Lucy and Ethel at the candy factory assembly line. I'm old. Oh, they keep an audience angry and distracted. During the 2020 election, false stories were constantly repeated by the Dems in media, and it worked. Biden got elected. Meanwhile, the Washington Post one journalism's equivalent of the Stanley Cup, see what I did there, Sean? For their video timeline of the made-up photo op. I wonder what the angry white male has to say.

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: I don't expect to retraction. I don't even want one. I didn't believe that story when it came out. Now, I like to keep my relationship with the mainstream media exactly where it is. You guys keep writing stories. I'll keep ignoring them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You've heard of fan fiction. Well, this is hate fiction. No different than the fine people on both sides of this issue hoax, which Joe Biden says inspired him to run for office. But there's so many others. Remember when time reporters Zeke Miller wrote that a bust of Martin Luther King Jr. had been removed from the Oval Office. Outrage ensued but it turns out the bust had been there all along. He just hadn't seen it. I guess the bust of famous black people all look alike to Miller. How about when the media were convinced Trump had photoshopped his hands to make them look bigger for a White House picture? they bought that. Or when the press said that Trump threatened to invade Mexico. These people lie more than I did when I was dating. Then there was the tale of Trump killing the fish in the White House koi pond by overfeeding them. And then Trump renaming Black History Month and Trump easing Russian sanctions, Trump recommending injecting bleach into your veins to beat COVID. All lies but were reported as facts. Then there's stuff that don't involve Trump but harmed you. The dismissal of spikes and violence across the country to protect the defund the cop's narrative. The demonization of law enforcement in the white washing of criminal past to maintain victim status. All is choreographed as Lady Gaga as backup dancers. If I started listing all of these fake fables, we'd have to preempt tomorrow's Fox and Friends which would piss up Brian Kilmeade because he just got a perm. I get it. I'm getting tired of my own ravings about the media, but I can't stop. This is the only industry designed to lie and then create awards to champion their lies. It's the only industry that ruins careers and futures just for the hell of it. And unlike the corporate media, I am not exaggerating. You don't have to like Trump or be Republican or be anything at all to be wary of the punitive power of the press. Like a serial killer on the loose. They think they can get away with (BLEEP) because they always do. It's why every day you must doubt what you hear, including from me. As unlikely as such a thing sounds, I'd love for you to prove me wrong because believe it or not, I can be wrong. Who am I kidding? I've never wrong.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guests. If Fox News was a boat, she'd be the weekend anchor. Fox News anchor Julian Banderas. He's made his sport out of tormenting leftist. OutKick.com founder and Fox Sports Contributor, Clay Travis. He's the main reason this show needs to have a penalty box. Former NHL player Sean Avery. And her preferred pronouns are me and first. Fox News Contributor, Kat Timpf. So, Julie, you claimed to be a news anchor but it's on the weekend. So, we can't have it. We don't have any proof. Why do the anchors have such a hard time reporting the truth?

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Well, it depends where you work. So, we're -- like allegedly, like if I'm just the news let's -- let me play a news anchor for a second. Where do I work? Like just pick a network.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: CNN.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Do we report the truth? Well, it depends who's telling us. Like where we're reading that story or where we're getting our information from. But as far as, you know, basically pepper spray being sprayed at demonstrators all because of get this and this is where the reporter comes in. The Interior Department inspector general found that poor communication, they're blaming it on poor communication, which then leads me to my next point between agencies that may have contributed to confusion during the operation. Poor communication, they need to go to marriage counseling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Because I speak from experience when there's poor communication, there's a breakdown, then you end up next thing, you know, you wake up with three kids and a divorce. I haven't gotten to the last part. I'm getting there. But I would say, you know, these people were pepper sprayed over the false narrative that they were clearing this area for a fence, not for the fence at the border, but for a fence that they were clearing out before the President. And it's shameful actually, that the networks are not reporting the facts. I mean, abcnews.com actually had an article on this. But I'm wondering if the evening news on ABC is going to be reporting it because there's a huge disconnect between online like, oh, if we clear up our B.S online then we don't actually have to say it on T.V.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right, right, right.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Right? There's a huge --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That -- they always do that. All the corrections are never seen the same way.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: No. No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sean, you are probably in my mind the -- one of the most media savvy, pro athletes. You were an intern at Vogue which is amazing. The only NHL hockey -- the only hockey player in history to be an intern. And you were like me on the list of sexiest man alive in 2007. Which I rejected because I am totally against being objectified. But, you know, whatever. You must realize how fake the media is the moment you become the subject of a story. Right?

utterances.speaker: SEAN AVERY, FORMER NHL PLAYER
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, I -- although I have a little bit of an issue, because you guys told me that Chris Cuomo was going to be on this panel. That's the only reason that I came on to the show. Now -- yes, no, I mean, man, the media. I think that it -- what's interesting in sports is that an athletes have figured it out. The only way that they answer questions when the media asks them a question is by every single one of them saying the exact same thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right, right, right.

utterances.speaker: AVERY
utterances.sentences: So they can never get themselves in trouble. There -- it's just clear, if you verbatim every single sport. Football, hockey, basketball, they answer the question the exact same way. So, you can't even really tell if the media is telling the truth if the athletes telling the truth, no one knows really what's going on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly. Although I have to commend you. You did a great podcast interview with Dana Perino. You got her to seem like a real person. Not the monster that she is. We all know that she is an awful person. The only think she's kind to his her dog. Clay, what is the thing that disturbs you most about these stories? That there's so many or --

utterances.speaker: CLAY TRAVIS, FOUNDER, OUTKIK
utterances.sentences: that they're all wrong, and never wrong in Trump's favor?

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Right? I mean, just think about it. The New York Times, the Washington Post, CNN, MSNBC, they're -- no one is infallible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: But you would think if you were going to get stories wrong guys, all the time --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Then some time, it would be an amazingly positive story that was false.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Every single one of these stories that you ran through that we've gotten wrong, they've all been negative to Trump, which to me, is perfect evidence of the bias that's in play. Because if there wasn't, there'd be something really great out there about Trump. And we want to say, Oh, that's a really good story. And then it comes out later that it's false. They didn't ever have one of those stories. And to me, that's transparent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. And so that's kind of the parallel, I guess, I'm probably just going to recapitulate what you said. They're -- the stories -- all the stories support the media assumption.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They begin support -- like, every assumption about life is -- and then, like, no one has ever apologized to the media for saying, wow, what you said when we said -- we thought it was wrong turns out to be right. There's no history of that.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No one -- I've never had to apologize to the media for saying when that -- remember I said you were (BLEEP) I was wrong. That's never happened, Kat. It has never happened.

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: No. And it's -- they report these things and then it also becomes their lives. They live in breed this stuff like wow, can you believe it? But then they're also were mad at you if you don't. The tear gas thing was huge. It was all anybody was talking about. I would post a picture of my dog on Instagram, and I accidentally clicked (INAUDIBLE) like, how can you be posting when Trump is tear gassing protesters. Like -- so, like, it's a dog. It's my puppy. You can't just look at a puppy?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That's pretty sad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're the real victim.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I know totally. Always I need to be the victim or else I don't know how to behave.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, you better finish the thought?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Well, no, I think it's mind blowing. And they have this moral superiority when meanwhile you're (BLEEP) on zoom like Jeffrey Toobin. And then he gets to go on T.V. and talk about it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, you know what's so great about Toobin? I'm going to take two bites off that apple. We're doing it tonight and then we're going to do it again tomorrow and -- well, I'm going to --

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: I think you might have to come back Monday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, I think -- I think we just got to keep -- all Toobin, Jeffrey Toobin week.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: - - they picked her?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is a pretty quick question.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: -- why, do they have a meeting? Like why was she the one to talk about Toobin and masturbate?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Did they -- did they have -- did they bring all the anchors into a room?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And then why did he go? Why did he go?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: (BLEEP) Zoom call and like we want to talk about a few interviews, like I will go.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: I would not allow her to come back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, that would have been fantastic.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: -- button and like all the stuff that went on in his office. I mean, if I get one masturbation story, I want at least --

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Did the CNN executives say we can't have a --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A man.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: A man do this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Because it will look like we're not treating it seriously.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, have a woman --

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: But whoever gets to come out and talk after you've obviously been guilty?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Oh man. That works at CNN.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have to say though. It kind of took balls for me to do that.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: I mean, no pun intended.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: He's also -- he's not a young guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, he's in his 60s I think. He's lived a full life.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: AVERY
utterances.sentences: Do we know what he was --

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Looking at?

utterances.speaker: AVERY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. You know what, they've never said that. That's the million- dollar question.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: That's the first thing that I thought too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's the million-dollar question. Because if it was the women on the Zoom call, that's another story. But we --

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Also, even weirder.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: I mean, this is beyond Julie Banderas weird stuff.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: It really is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Next, if you don't see eye to eye will liberals say bye-bye?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Are liberals so disturbed they kick their friends to the curb. According to findings by the Survey Center on American Life, Democrats are twice as likely as Republicans to say they ended a friendship over a political disagreement. 20 percent of them say they've done it versus just 10 percent of Republicans. 20 percent versus 10 percent. That's double. Which incidentally is what Julie only drinks. Drunk. Anyway, the group that does is the most, liberal women. 33 percent said they've cut ties with the friend over political differences. And about one in five who's done it said that disagreements have been about, you guessed it, Donald Trump. Amazing. I would have guessed international monetary policy or Smith Holly act. I don't even know what that is. So, you can still get along. Can you still get along? If your friends view seems wrong?

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Apparently in this day and age, the answer is no. You know what reminds me what my doctor said this morning. You should probably stop doing that. It looks very sore. All right.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Toobin's doctor said the same thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. We have the same physician. And yes, I don't do the Zoom calls. Kat, I got to go you first on this because you're a woman.

utterances.speaker: AVERY
utterances.sentences: There you go. Boom.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Congrats on the surgery.

utterances.speaker: AVERY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: He's saying I used to be a man. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I didn't say that. You could have been like a unicorn. All right. So what drives me -- because I this is a careful question. The couples that no longer speak to me are always ginned up by the woman. It's not the guy. The guy is at -- the could both hate Trump or what -- or hate Fox. But they're still my friends. But it's always the woman that is the one pushing that thing in every situation. Why is that?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That's interesting, because you're making me think I need to be a more aggressive wife. Yes (INAUDIBLE) a couple friends, I don't enjoy it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Oh, you have the total power 00

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Oh. That is good to learn. That's good to learn. It's not because of politics it's just because of the stuff they say in general.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And the people that they are.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Name names. That will -- that will --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Just kidding. This is just content. That is interesting. Because I feel like for me, it's in couples that don't talk to me anymore. It's the wives as well.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It is such a weird thing because I don't know if it's an evolutionary thing, Clay, that like, you know, they see that Trump reminds them have something.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It reminds him of a domineering figure or whatever is -- I don't know, is this happened -- has this happened to you?

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Yes. I've seen it happening all over social media. What I think happens is a lot of men are clueless when slights are being directed towards us, right? We aren't emotionally intelligent enough. I'll put myself in this category.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: To know, when somebody is trying to alienate you in some way. A woman might recognize that slight, whereas a man is totally oblivious to it. And so, I think these conversations that start off, it can be the tone, it can be the glancing, the way that people are interacting. And I think women are more likely to pick up on those cues than men are. And then that creates more of a tension. But I think it's --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Also fighting releases dopamine. You start a little drama.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hmm. Interesting.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: I love dopamine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sean, I don't know anything about your politics at all. And I don't see -- I don't -- I would -- are you overtly political?

utterances.speaker: AVERY
utterances.sentences: So -- well, actually, I can't -- I'm in the process of becoming an American citizen. So, I technically can't vote.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: AVERY
utterances.sentences: But I was told by Alan Dershowitz that I'm a liberal conservative. So, because of that I moved to California to become friends with Democrats.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How's it working?

utterances.speaker: AVERY

utterances.sentences: Do you see this as a period as any different than any other period? It's just that we have more outlets like social media to see the dissent or the discontent?

utterances.speaker: AVERY

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: AVERY
utterances.sentences: So, it doesn't seem weird to me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: AVERY
utterances.sentences: Like it seems kind of natural. I -- the dopamine gets --

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: There you go.

utterances.speaker: AVERY
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's pretty --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But you always go to the next step and then hit them.

utterances.speaker: AVERY
utterances.sentences: That I'm trying to stay away from. Yes.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: When's the last time you hit someone?

utterances.speaker: AVERY
utterances.sentences: I don't -- I don't want to talk about it.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: On the way in.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Doocy gave him a bad look.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Doocy see on the floor. Here's your "FOX AND FRIENDS."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Julie, in order to cut out friends from your life, you have to have friends. So, I know this must be hard to understand.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: This is a tricky question. I knew this was going to come up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Because, you know, friendships are --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS

But I have to say this, I do understand why women are the ones who were basically dictating who come in and out of the house because like, again with the dopamine and I have hit someone Within the last 24 hours. So, you know, what -- but I don't understand this, and this is what I don't get. Democrats, it -- they -- it takes politics for them to decide whether to be friends because they have the saying, you know, don't judge a book by its cover, I am the opposite. I say judge. And anyone I meet, you're guilty until proven innocent. I'd make the best juror. And within two minutes I know if you're going to be my friend, and the way I do that is what I have drank with you before I had children. With -- and that's how I judge. Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: It's a really great one. I mean --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: You drink with me or while with your children.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And get drunk with your children.

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: Yes. And therefore, I like you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I've only lost friends. I didn't really mind losing. I mean, you know, that's just how you got to look at it, you know, it's like --

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: And you won't miss them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you don't miss him. In fact, as you get older, you got to start, you know --

utterances.speaker: BANDERAS
utterances.sentences: One or two is my max.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly, exactly. You got to have --

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS
utterances.sentences: I think you've --
